sections.title_cn: 1.将其列为下一年度执法检查“双随机”重点抽查对象，
sections.title_en: 1. List them as key targets for "double random" spot inspections in the next year's law enforcement inspections,
sections.body_cn:
根据有权机关提供的案件线索，及时进行研判，对存在重大
涉案线索的机构，组织开展执法检查；
sections.body_en:
Based on the case clues provided by the competent authorities, conduct timely research and judgment to identify major
The agencies involved in the case will organize law enforcement inspections;

sections.title_cn: 2.列入日常监管重点关注对象，强化备付金存放与使
sections.title_en: 2. Include key objects of daily supervision and strengthen the storage and use of reserve funds.
sections.body_cn: 用、支付业务合规性等方面监管；
sections.body_en: Supervision on compliance of usage and payment business;

sections.title_cn: 3.向中国支付清算协会通报风险情况，在自律检查、外
sections.title_en: 3. Report the risk situation to the China Payment and Clearing Association, and conduct self-regulatory inspections and external inspections.
sections.body_cn: 包机构管理等方面强化约束；
sections.body_en: Strengthen constraints on organizational management and other aspects;

sections.title_cn: 4.向清算机构通报风险情况，加强备付金出入金管理及
sections.title_en: 4. Report the risk situation to the clearing agency, strengthen the management of deposits and withdrawals of reserve funds and
sections.body_cn:
支付交易监测。
对于 C 类、D 类、E 类支付机构，若本年度内已经开展
过执法检查且完成整改的，中国人民银行及其分支机构可以
根据实际监管需要，决定下一年度是否对其开展执法检查。
第十五条（评级结果使用范围） 支付机构分类评级结
果仅限中国人民银行及其分支机构监管使用，原则上不对外
披露。确有必要时，中国人民银行及其分支机构可以以适当
方式向其他监管部门、政府部门等提供，但应当要求其不得
向第三方披露或者公开。
支付机构不得将分类评级结果用于广告、宣传、营销等
商业目的。
第四章 组织实施
第十六条（适用对象） 分类评级对象为截至上一自然
年度末，设立已满一年的支付机构。
6

分类评级工作期间，若支付机构已经注销或者被吊销支
付业务许可证，中国人民银行及其分支机构不再对其进行评
级。
第十七条（自评要求） 支付机构应当实事求是、全面
完整开展自评，如实向住所所在地中国人民银行分支机构提
供相关数据和信息，反映自身情况、存在的问题以及被采取
的监管措施，并将自评报告和相关材料于每年 4 月 30 日前
报送住所所在地中国人民银行分支机构。
支付机构应当确保提供数据和信息的真实性和准确性，
自行承担提供虚假、错误数据和信息导致的不利后果。
第十八条（初评要求） 中国人民银行分支机构应当持
续、全面、深入收集分类评级所需的各类信息，包括但不限
于：非现场监管信息、现场检查报告、专项监管情况、支付
机构有关制度办法、内外部审计报告等经营管理文件，信访
举报以及其他重要内外部信息。
中国人民银行分支机构应当根据日常监管情况，综合分
析支付机构相关信息，采取检查调查、现场核实、征询意见
等手段，就支付机构有关问题进行核实、确认，并对支付机
构评价计分，于每年 6 月 30 日前以行发文形式将初评报告
和初评计分结果报送中国人民银行。
第十九条（复评要求） 中国人民银行对支付机构分类
评级初评结果进行复核，确定分类评级最终结果，于每年 8
月 31 日前向中国人民银行分支机构反馈分类评级结果和得
分情况。
7

第二十条（通知结果） 中国人民银行分支机构应当通
过监管约谈、监管意见书等方式，向支付机构通知分类评级
结果及其存在的主要问题。支付机构收到分类评级结果后，
应当于 20 个工作日内向中国人民银行分支机构报送加盖公
司公章的整改方案。
支付机构对分类评级结果有异议的，应当于收到分类评
级结果通知之日起 10 个工作日内，向住所所在地中国人民
银行分支机构提交加盖公司公章的书面意见及说明材料；中
国人民银行分支机构进行核实确认，视情提请中国人民银行
作出调整。
第二十一条（信息共享） 中国人民银行及其分支机构
应当与清算机构、中国支付清算协会之间建立健全信息共享
机制，强化业务合规、风险状况、自律管理等方面信息的互
通共享。
中国人民银行分支机构之间应当加强监管协同和信息
共享，及时通报支付机构分支机构情况、支付机构分类评级
结果等信息。
第五章 附则
第二十二条（解释权） 本办法由中国人民银行负责解
释。
第二十三条（施行日） 本办法自 202×年×月×日起施
行。《中国人民银行关于建立支付机构监管报告制度的通知》
（银发〔2012〕176 号）、《中国人民银行关于发布<非银行
8

支付机构分类评级管理办法>的通知》（银发〔2016〕106 号）、
《中国人民银行办公厅关于修订非银行支付机构分类评级
相关指标的通知》（银办发〔2017〕21 号）同时废止。其他
制度规定与本办法不一致的，以本办法规定为准。此前发布
的根据支付机构分类评级结果设置分类管理措施的规定，凡
与本办法不一致的，按照本办法执行。
附：支付机构分类评级材料规范要求
9

附
支付机构分类评级材料规范要求
一、自评报告编写要求。支付机构应当根据分类评级计分标
准进行自评，编写自评报告。自评报告需根据计分标准逐条描述
评分依据，并提供相应说明材料。其中，涉及的财务数据以经审
计的年度财务报告为准，业务数据以报送中国人民银行的季度数
据为准。
二、材料报送要求。自评报告需提交纸质材料，包括完整的
自评报告 1 份、“系统安全”部分自评报告 1 份、“反洗钱措施”
部分自评报告 1 份。说明材料应当根据分类评级指标顺序进行编
号，与自评说明一一对应。说明材料需通过数据光盘提交，一式
3 份。
三、材料真实性要求。支付机构应对提交的自评报告和说明
材料出具真实性声明承诺函（加盖公司公章并经法定代表人签
字）。
10
sections.body_en:
Payment transaction monitoring.
For Class C, Class D, and Class E payment institutions, if they have already carried out
After passing the law enforcement inspection and completing rectification, the People's Bank of China and its branches may
Based on actual regulatory needs, it will be decided whether to carry out law enforcement inspections in the next year.
Article 15 (Scope of use of rating results) Classified rating results of payment institutions
It is limited to the supervision and use of the People's Bank of China and its branches and is not open to the public in principle.
Disclosure. When necessary, the People's Bank of China and its branches may use appropriate
methods to other regulatory authorities, government departments, etc., but they should be required not to
Disclose or make public to third parties.
Payment institutions shall not use classification rating results for advertising, publicity, marketing, etc.
Business purposes.
Chapter 4 Organization and Implementation
Article 16 (Applicable objects) The classification and rating objects are as of the last natural
At the end of the year, payment institutions that have been established for one year shall be established.
6

During the classification and rating work, if the payment institution has been canceled or has its payment revoked,
business license, the People's Bank of China and its branches will no longer evaluate it
level.
Article 17 (Self-evaluation Requirements) Payment institutions should be realistic and comprehensive
Conduct a complete self-assessment and truthfully submit an application to the branch of the People's Bank of China where your residence is located
Provide relevant data and information to reflect your own situation, existing problems and measures taken
supervisory measures, and submit self-assessment reports and related materials before April 30 of each year.
Report to the branch of the People's Bank of China where your domicile is located.
Payment institutions should ensure the authenticity and accuracy of the data and information provided,
You are responsible for any adverse consequences caused by providing false or incorrect data and information.
Article 18 (Preliminary Evaluation Requirements) The branches of the People’s Bank of China shall maintain
Continue to, comprehensively and in-depth collect all kinds of information required for classification and rating, including but not limited to
In: off-site supervision information, on-site inspection reports, special supervision status, payment
Relevant institutional regulations, internal and external audit reports and other operational and management documents, letters and visits
Reports and other important internal and external information.
The branches of the People's Bank of China shall comprehensively analyze
Analyze relevant information of payment institutions and conduct inspections, on-site verifications, and solicit opinions
and other means to verify and confirm issues related to the payment institution, and
The structural evaluation will be scored and the preliminary evaluation report will be issued in the form of a written document before June 30 of each year.
and preliminary scoring results shall be submitted to the People's Bank of China.
Article 19 (Re-evaluation Requirements) Classification of payment institutions by the People’s Bank of China
The preliminary rating results will be reviewed to determine the final classification rating results in August every year.
Feedback the classified rating results and scores to the branches of the People's Bank of China before March 31st.
Depending on the situation.
7

Article 20 (Notification Result) The branches of the People’s Bank of China shall notify
Notify payment institutions of classification ratings through regulatory interviews, regulatory opinions, etc.
Results and main problems. After the payment institution receives the classification rating results,
A stamped official statement must be submitted to the branch of the People's Bank of China within 20 working days.
The rectification plan for the company’s corporate seal.
If a payment institution has any objection to the classification rating results, it shall
Within 10 working days from the date of notification of grade-level results, the Chinese people at the place of domicile
The bank branch shall submit written opinions and explanatory materials stamped with the company's official seal;
The branch of the People's Bank of China will conduct verification and confirmation and submit it to the People's Bank of China as appropriate.
Make adjustments.
Article 21 (Information Sharing) The People’s Bank of China and its branches
Sound information sharing should be established with clearing institutions and the China Payment and Clearing Association.
mechanism to strengthen the exchange of information on business compliance, risk status, self-discipline management, etc.
Pass sharing.
The branches of the People's Bank of China should strengthen regulatory coordination and information
Share and promptly report the status of payment institution branches and payment institution classification ratings
Results and other information.
Chapter 5 Supplementary Provisions
Article 22 (Right of Interpretation) The People’s Bank of China is responsible for interpreting these Measures.
explanation.
Article 23 (Implementation Date) These Measures shall come into effect on ×month ×day 202
OK. "Notice of the People's Bank of China on Establishing a Supervision and Reporting System for Payment Institutions"
(Yinfa [2012] No. 176), "The People's Bank of China issued the
8

Notice on the Management Measures for Classified Rating of Payment Institutions (Yinfa [2016] No. 106),
"The General Office of the People's Bank of China on Revising the Classification Ratings of Non-bank Payment Institutions"
Notice on Relevant Indicators (Yinbanfa [2017] No. 21) was abolished at the same time. Others
If the system provisions are inconsistent with these Measures, the provisions of these Measures shall prevail. Previously published
The provisions on setting up classified management measures based on the classification and rating results of payment institutions.
If it is inconsistent with these Measures, these Measures shall apply.
Attached: Standard requirements for classification and rating materials of payment institutions
9

attached
Specification requirements for classification and rating materials of payment institutions
1. Requirements for writing self-evaluation reports. Payment institutions should score targets based on classification ratings
Conduct self-evaluation and prepare self-evaluation report. The self-evaluation report must be described item by item according to the scoring criteria.
Basis for scoring and provide corresponding explanatory materials. Among them, the financial data involved have been audited
The annual financial report shall be based on the calculation, and the business data shall be based on the quarterly figures submitted to the People's Bank of China.
shall prevail.
2. Material submission requirements. The self-evaluation report must be submitted in hard copy, including a complete
1 self-assessment report, 1 self-assessment report on the "System Security" section, and "Anti-Money Laundering Measures"
1 partial self-evaluation report. Explanatory materials should be compiled according to the order of classification and rating indicators.
number, corresponding to the self-assessment instructions. Explanation materials must be submitted via data CD, in one copy
Serves 3.
3. Material authenticity requirements. Payment institutions should submit self-assessment reports and explanations
A letter of commitment to declare the authenticity of the materials (stamped with the company’s official seal and signed by the legal representative)
words).

一、自评报告编写要求。支付机构应当根据分类评级计分标
准进行自评，编写自评报告。自评报告需根据计分标准逐条描述
评分依据，并提供相应说明材料。其中，涉及的财务数据以经审
计的年度财务报告为准，业务数据以报送中国人民银行的季度数
据为准。
二、材料报送要求。自评报告需提交纸质材料，包括完整的
自评报告 1 份、“系统安全”部分自评报告 1 份、“反洗钱措施”
部分自评报告 1 份。说明材料应当根据分类评级指标顺序进行编
号，与自评说明一一对应。说明材料需通过数据光盘提交，一式
3 份。
三、材料真实性要求。支付机构应对提交的自评报告和说明
材料出具真实性声明承诺函（加盖公司公章并经法定代表人签
字）。

For Class C, Class D, and Class E payment institutions, if they have already carried out

Based on actual regulatory needs, it will be decided whether to carry out law enforcement inspections in the next year.
Article 15 (Scope of use of rating results) Classified rating results of payment institutions
It is limited to the supervision and use of the People's Bank of China and its branches and is not open to the public in principle.
Disclosure. When necessary, the People's Bank of China and its branches may use appropriate
methods to other regulatory authorities, government departments, etc., but they should be required not to
Disclose or make public to third parties.
Payment institutions shall not use classification rating results for advertising, publicity, marketing, etc.
Business purposes.

Article 16 (Applicable objects) The classification and rating objects are as of the last natural
At the end of the year, payment institutions that have been established for one year shall be established.

Provide relevant data and information to reflect your own situation, existing problems and measures taken
supervisory measures, and submit self-assessment reports and related materials before April 30 of each year.
Report to the branch of the People's Bank of China where your domicile is located.
Payment institutions should ensure the authenticity and accuracy of the data and information provided,
You are responsible for any adverse consequences caused by providing false or incorrect data and information.

Continue to, comprehensively and in-depth collect all kinds of information required for classification and rating, including but not limited to
In: off-site supervision information, on-site inspection reports, special supervision status, payment
Relevant institutional regulations, internal and external audit reports and other operational and management documents, letters and visits
Reports and other important internal and external information.

The structural evaluation will be scored and the preliminary evaluation report will be issued in the form of a written document before June 30 of each year.
and preliminary scoring results shall be submitted to the People's Bank of China.
Article 19 (Re-evaluation Requirements) Classification of payment institutions by the People’s Bank of China
The preliminary rating results will be reviewed to determine the final classification rating results in August every year.
Feedback the classified rating results and scores to the branches of the People's Bank of China before March 31st.

7

Article 20 (Notification Result) The branches of the People’s Bank of China shall notify
Notify payment institutions of classification ratings through regulatory interviews, regulatory opinions, etc.
Results and main problems. After the payment institution receives the classification rating results,
A stamped official statement must be submitted to the branch of the People's Bank of China within 20 working days.
The rectification plan for the company’s corporate seal.
If a payment institution has any objection to the classification rating results, it shall
Within 10 working days from the date of notification of grade-level results, the Chinese people at the place of domicile
The bank branch shall submit written opinions and explanatory materials stamped with the company's official seal;
The branch of the People's Bank of China will conduct verification and confirmation and submit it to the People's Bank of China as appropriate.
Make adjustments.
Article 21 (Information Sharing) The People’s Bank of China and its branches
Sound information sharing should be established with clearing institutions and the China Payment and Clearing Association.
mechanism to strengthen the exchange of information on business compliance, risk status, self-discipline management, etc.
Pass sharing.
The branches of the People's Bank of China should strengthen regulatory coordination and information
Share and promptly report the status of payment institution branches and payment institution classification ratings
Results and other information.

Article 22 (Right of Interpretation) The People’s Bank of China is responsible for interpreting these Measures.
explanation.

attached
Specification requirements for classification and rating materials of payment institutions
1. Requirements for writing self-evaluation reports. Payment institutions should score targets based on classification ratings
Conduct self-evaluation and prepare self-evaluation report. The self-evaluation report must be described item by item according to the scoring criteria.
Basis for scoring and provide corresponding explanatory materials. Among them, the financial data involved have been audited
The annual financial report shall be based on the calculation, and the business data shall be based on the quarterly figures submitted to the People's Bank of China.
shall prevail.
2. Material submission requirements. The self-evaluation report must be submitted in hard copy, including a complete
1 self-assessment report, 1 self-assessment report on the "System Security" section, and "Anti-Money Laundering Measures"
1 partial self-evaluation report. Explanatory materials should be compiled according to the order of classification and rating indicators.
number, corresponding to the self-assessment instructions. Explanation materials must be submitted via data CD, in one copy
Serves 3.
3. Material authenticity requirements. Payment institutions should submit self-assessment reports and explanations
A letter of commitment to declare the authenticity of the materials (stamped with the company’s official seal and signed by the legal representative)
words).

{'type': 'missing', 'loc': ('sections', 3, 'heading_en'), 'msg': 'Field required', 'input': {'title_cn': '4.向清算机构通报风险情况，加强备付金出入金管理及', 'title_en': '4. Report the risk situation to the clearing agency, strengthen the management of deposits and withdrawals of reserve funds and', 'body_cn': '支付交易监测。
对于 C 类、D 类、E 类支付机构，若本年度内已经开展
过执法检查且完成整改的，中国人民银行及其分支机构可以
根据实际监管需要，决定下一年度是否对其开展执法检查。
第十五条（评级结果使用范围） 支付机构分类评级结
果仅限中国人民银行及其分支机构监管使用，原则上不对外
披露。确有必要时，中国人民银行及其分支机构可以以适当
方式向其他监管部门、政府部门等提供，但应当要求其不得
向第三方披露或者公开。
支付机构不得将分类评级结果用于广告、宣传、营销等
商业目的。
第四章 组织实施
第十六条（适用对象） 分类评级对象为截至上一自然
年度末，设立已满一年的支付机构。
6

分类评级工作期间，若支付机构已经注销或者被吊销支
付业务许可证，中国人民银行及其分支机构不再对其进行评
级。
第十七条（自评要求） 支付机构应当实事求是、全面
完整开展自评，如实向住所所在地中国人民银行分支机构提
供相关数据和信息，反映自身情况、存在的问题以及被采取
的监管措施，并将自评报告和相关材料于每年 4 月 30 日前
报送住所所在地中国人民银行分支机构。
支付机构应当确保提供数据和信息的真实性和准确性，
自行承担提供虚假、错误数据和信息导致的不利后果。
第十八条（初评要求） 中国人民银行分支机构应当持
续、全面、深入收集分类评级所需的各类信息，包括但不限
于：非现场监管信息、现场检查报告、专项监管情况、支付
机构有关制度办法、内外部审计报告等经营管理文件，信访
举报以及其他重要内外部信息。
中国人民银行分支机构应当根据日常监管情况，综合分
析支付机构相关信息，采取检查调查、现场核实、征询意见
等手段，就支付机构有关问题进行核实、确认，并对支付机
构评价计分，于每年 6 月 30 日前以行发文形式将初评报告
和初评计分结果报送中国人民银行。
第十九条（复评要求） 中国人民银行对支付机构分类
评级初评结果进行复核，确定分类评级最终结果，于每年 8
月 31 日前向中国人民银行分支机构反馈分类评级结果和得
分情况。
7

第二十条（通知结果） 中国人民银行分支机构应当通
过监管约谈、监管意见书等方式，向支付机构通知分类评级
结果及其存在的主要问题。支付机构收到分类评级结果后，
应当于 20 个工作日内向中国人民银行分支机构报送加盖公
司公章的整改方案。
支付机构对分类评级结果有异议的，应当于收到分类评
级结果通知之日起 10 个工作日内，向住所所在地中国人民
银行分支机构提交加盖公司公章的书面意见及说明材料；中
国人民银行分支机构进行核实确认，视情提请中国人民银行
作出调整。
第二十一条（信息共享） 中国人民银行及其分支机构
应当与清算机构、中国支付清算协会之间建立健全信息共享
机制，强化业务合规、风险状况、自律管理等方面信息的互
通共享。
中国人民银行分支机构之间应当加强监管协同和信息
共享，及时通报支付机构分支机构情况、支付机构分类评级
结果等信息。
第五章 附则
第二十二条（解释权） 本办法由中国人民银行负责解
释。
第二十三条（施行日） 本办法自 202×年×月×日起施
行。《中国人民银行关于建立支付机构监管报告制度的通知》
（银发〔2012〕176 号）、《中国人民银行关于发布<非银行
8

支付机构分类评级管理办法>的通知》（银发〔2016〕106 号）、
《中国人民银行办公厅关于修订非银行支付机构分类评级
相关指标的通知》（银办发〔2017〕21 号）同时废止。其他
制度规定与本办法不一致的，以本办法规定为准。此前发布
的根据支付机构分类评级结果设置分类管理措施的规定，凡
与本办法不一致的，按照本办法执行。
